intro: Cyathea insularum, commonly known as the island tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, unbranched trunk covered in a thick, fibrous rind. The plant features a crown of large, feather-like fronds that can grow up to several meters in length. Cyathea insularum thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Its unique morphology makes it an important component of the island's botanical diversity.
